Description:
When you are about to reach young Amelia and escape the forge, a rift appears between your party and her. This portal has is like the one that brought you here.

You can’t waste this opportunity to come back to the present and without thinking it twice, you cross the rift.

Just before going back to your time, you are able to see how the explosions and the lava engulf the Black Forge.
DescriptionAction: This is how your adventure in the past ends.

On her report, she wrote about a group of irregular soldiers that helped her and her party to end with the Obsidian Uprising, but, unfortunately, that group didn’t survive. To honour that group a monument was built on the city of Velkarath.

Advisor Amelia rewarded the three heroes who helped her and she forgave the surviving dwarves of the black forge, as long as they swear to abandon the research and machinery that they produced during the Obsidian Uprising. I reported that a group of irregulars helped us to quell the uprising but they didn’t make it out of the forge. I never expected that I myself was part of that group!

That experience forged a bond between Nenukil, Wilbur, Cornelius and me. After that I offered them a reward, whatever they wanted.

Wilbur asked for help with his new research, Nenukil asked to become part of my retinue and Cornelius asked me… a personal favor.”", "SSRewardTier": "", "SSRoll": false, "SSRollCard": "None", (Cornelius) “Now I remember it clearly. It is a nightmare that I have every day. I did what I had to do in order to save us all.

The fight against the dwarf general was exhausting. I was weakened, at my limit, and summoning Belphyor took a great toll on my mind and strength.

I knew my mind would start to fail me soon and that I wouldn’t be able to take care of the only person I had left: my newborn granddaughter. So, before things got worse, I asked Amelia to take care of her. She took care of my… Evelyn.\"", "SSRewardTier": "", "SSRoll": false, "SSRollCard": "None", "SSRollMode": "HigherOrEqual", "SSRollNumber": 0, "SSRollNumberCritical": -1, "SSRollNumberCriticalFail":
